comments.text: UT Dallas, University of Pittsburgh, Rutgers University, UNCC, UMBC
UCR , it's amazing and has gre waived off too
It's a usual delay. It takes around 15 business days for ielts to send your official score report

Stanford is isolated: it's a very pretty but sometimes dull campus. Students rely on bikes: dangerous traffic jams on campus! Pre-Covid, dorm rooms small and shared: school had little options for those with crazy roommates. Wonderful research opportunities: profs open to exploration of topics of interest. Personalized education: you aren't just a face in the crowd. Library system terrific: they help! Grading is fair, not on a curve.
Very welcoming environment. Professors are very understanding and want you to succeed. This is a challenging school and clearly geared towards people with a tendency towards logic and math.
I loved Stevens and the engineering curriculum. Every semester you have design projects that really help you apply what you learn in the classroom.

I recently completed my first semester at USC and I gotta say, the hype really exists for a reason. Most of my expectations were met and some were even exceeded by my experience at this school. There's a lot of reviews and advice about USC out there, but one thing I would say is this: if you are the kind of person who can easily feel lonely or isolated in a new city or institution, this is the place for you. Making friends is literally so easy here and it is very unlikely for someone to feel a low sense of community here. Fight On!
Rutgers University, you will have great opportunities after Master's program
Hi, I have received an admit from University of Connecticut.
It takes around 10-15 business days for ielts to send the scores to university.
I think you should go for generalised computer science since it gives you opportunity to explore more.
